election_record.label: New York 1806 State Senate, Middle District

overview.note: The official canvass of votes gives 5309 votes for James Burt, 5191 votes for Elisha Barlow, 3322 votes for James W. Wilkin, and 3318 votes for Abraham H. Schenck in the Middle District. The votes from the various towns and counties, though, add up to the totals given here.

sub_unit.name: Columbia
sub_unit.note: Abraham H. Schenck received 4 vote as Abm. Schenck and 3 votes as Abraham Schenck.
James W. Wilkin received 2 votes as John W. Wilkin.

sub_unit.name: Hillsdale
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 13, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 9, list 254 votes for James W. Wilkin and 251 votes for Abraham W. Schenck in Hillsdale.

sub_unit.name: Hudson
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 13, and the American Citizen (New York, NY), May 9, list 151 votes for James W. Wilkin in Hudson.

sub_unit.name: Delaware
sub_unit.note: The Plebeian May 23, and Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 26, list 664 votes for Elisha Barlow in Delaware county.
James W. Wilkin received 8 votes as James Wilkins.

sub_unit.name: Amenia
sub_unit.note: Abraham H. Schenck received 1 vote as Abraham Schenck.

sub_unit.name: Beekman
sub_unit.note: Abraham H. Schenck received 4 votes as Abraham Schenck.

sub_unit.name: Carmel
sub_unit.note: Abraham H. Schenck received 56 votes as Abraham Scank.

sub_unit.name: Clinton
sub_unit.note: Abraham H. Schenck received 1 vote as Abraham Schenck.

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: John W. Wilkin received 1 vote as Jas. W. Wilkins.
The official canvass of votes lists 404 votes for James W. Wilkin in Greene county.

sub_unit.name: Catskill
sub_unit.note: Abraham H. Schenck received 1 vote as Abraham Schenck.

sub_unit.name: Durham
sub_unit.note: Abraham H. Schenck received 38 votes as Abraham Schenck.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: John W. Wilkin received 1 vote as Jas. W. Wilkins.
Abraham H. Schenck received 1 vote as Abraham Schenck.
Seventeen of Elisha Barlow's votes in Orange county were listed with the scattering votes, though his name was spelled correctly.
The official canvass of votes lists 475 votes for James W. Wilkin and 435 votes for Abraham H. Schenck in Orange county.

sub_unit.name: Blooming Grove
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 10, lists 1 vote for James W. Wilkin in Blooming Grove.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 10, lists 13 votes for James W. Wilkin in Montgomery.

sub_unit.name: Newburgh
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 10, lists 87 votes for James Burt, 123 for James W. Wilkin, and 123 for Abraham H. Schenck.

sub_unit.name: New Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 10, lists 72 votes for James W. Wilkin in New Windsor.

sub_unit.name: Wallkill
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 10, lists 55 votes for Abraham H. Schenck in Wallkill.

sub_unit.name: Rockland
sub_unit.note: The Republican Watch-Tower (New York, NY), May 13, lists 9 votes for James Burt and 19 votes for Elisha Barlow in Rockland county.

sub_unit.name: Ulster
sub_unit.note: The Albany Register (Albany, NY), May 13, lists 941 votes for Elisha Barlow in Ulster county.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Dutchess County Historian, Poughkeepsie.
Poughkeepsie Journal, and Constitutional Republican (Poughkeepsie, NY). May 15, 1806.
